bitidlogin: Used as page title in Special:BitIDLogin.
bitidserver: Used as page title of Special:BitIDServer.
bitid-identifier-page-text-user:
A short text which describes this technical BitID identifier page for a user. The page is used only during BitID authentication and is generally not visited otherwise.

Parameters:
* $1 - a user name
bitid-identifier-page-text-different-use:
A short text which describes this technical BitID identifier page for a user other than then the visiting logged-in user. The page is used only during BitID authentication and is generally not visited otherwise.

Parameters:
* $1 - a User ID
bitid-identifier-page-text-no-such-local: A short text which describes this technical BitID identifier page when the id (subpage) is not valid in that wiki, because no user has that User ID. The page is used only during BitID authentication and is generally not visited otherwise.
bitid-server-identity-page-text: A short text which describes this technical BitID server identity page which is only used during BitID authentication and not used otherwise.
bitidxrds:
Used as page title in Special:BitIDXRDS.

[[w:Yadis|Yadis]] is a communications protocol for discovery of services such as BitID, OAuth, and XDI connected to a Yadis ID.
bitidconvert: Used as page title in Special:BitIDConvert.
bitid-error-bitid-consumer-mode-disabled: Used as error message if someone tries to login with their BitID to this wiki, but the BitID consumer mode not being enabled here.
bitiderrortext:
Used as error message.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.
bitid-error-no-auth:
Used as error message in case that an unspecified authentication response/request error occurred during the verification of the BitID URL.

Parameter:
* $1 - a name or fully qualified URL for an internally pre-programmed provider

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.
bitid-error-server-response:
Used as error message during the verification of the BitID.

Parameters:
* $1 - a name or fully qualified URL for an internally pre-programmed provider
* $2 - the received server response

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.
bitid-error-request-forgery: The error message when an invalid token was found.
bitid-error-wrong-force-provider-setting:
Used as error message in case of an internal error occurred, if the URL value for a forced provider (designated by its internal name or a fully qualified URL) is incorrect because it contains a username parameter (it must not).

Parameters:
* $1 - a name or fully qualified URL for an internally pre-programmed provider

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.
bitid-error-bitid-convert-not-allowed-fo:
Used as error message if someone tries to directly access the BitID convert screen
even when the wiki only allowed a forced provider.

Parameter:
* $1 - a name or fully qualified URL for an internally pre-programmed provider

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.
bitidconfigerror:
Used as error title for the following error message:
* {{msg-mw|Openidconfigerrortext}}
bitidconfigerrortext:
Used as error message.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openidconfigerror}}.
bitidpermission:
Used as error title for the following error message:
* {{msg-mw|Openidpermissiontext}}
bitidpermissiontext:
Used as error message.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openidpermission}}.
bitidcancel:
Used as error title for the following error message:
* {{msg-mw|Openidcanceltext}}
bitidcanceltext:
Used as error message.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openidcancel}}.
bitidfailure:
Used as error title for the following error message:
* {{msg-mw|Openidfailuretext}}
bitidfailuretext:
Used as error message.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|Openidfailure}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - error message, or empty string
bitidsuccesstext:
Used as page body. The page title for this message is {{msg-mw|Openidsuccess}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a username
* $2 - an BitID
bitidusernameprefix: Used as username prefix, if the nickname is not defined or is empty.
bitidserverlogininstructions:
The message is shown to users when they want to log in on another site ($3) with their MediaWiki userpage URL (this MediaWiki as BitID server) acting as BitID identity.

If not logged in by cookie or session, the MediaWiki prompts the user to log in as user $2. After a successful login to the MediaWiki which acts as BitID server, the process flow is redirected to the other BitID consumer site, where the user will be logged via their (MediaWiki userpage) BitID.

System message output example after parameter substitution:

"http://www.consumer.org/foo requests that you enter your password for your user MeMyself page http://www.server.org/mediawiki/index.php/User:MeMyself (this is your BitID URL)"

Parameters:
* $1 - the fully specified user page URL which acts as BitID identity. This is the BitID identity for log-ins on the other, requesting site $3 (the BitID consumer site $3)
* $2 - MediaWiki account username (on this wiki, which acts as BitID server). Remark: a password must be associated to that MediaWiki account, BitID alone is not sufficient.
* $3 - BitID consumer site URL
bitidtrustinstructions:
Parameters:
* $1 - a trust root. A trust root looks much like a normal URL, but is used to describe a set of URLs. Trust roots are used by BitID to verify that a user has approved the BitID enabled website.
bitidallowtrust:
Used as label for the checkbox in Special:BitIDServer. Parameters:
* $1 - a trust root. A trust root looks much like a normal URL, but is used to describe a set of URLs. Trust roots are used by BitID to verify that a user has approved the BitID enabled website.
bitidpolicy:
unused at this time. Parameters:
* $1 - the URL
bitidchoosenick:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin. Parameters:
* $1 - nickname
bitidchoosefull:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin. Parameters:
* $1 - fullname
bitidchooseurl:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin. Parameters:
* $1 - BitID URL
bitidchooseauto:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin. Parameters:
* $1 - nickname. If nickname doesn't exist or is empty, $1 is {{msg-mw|bitidusernameprefix}}.
bitidchoosemanual:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin.

This message is followed by the "Account name" input box.
bitidchooseexisting:
Used as label for the radio button in Special:BitIDLogin.

This message is followed by the following messages:
* {{msg-mw|bitidchooseusername}} (an input box follows)
* {{msg-mw|bitidchoosepassword}} (an input box follows)
bitidchooseusername:
Used as label for input box in Special:BitIDLogin.
{{Identical|Username}}
bitidchoosepassword:
Used as label for the "Password" input box in Special:BitIDLogin.
{{Identical|Password}}
bitidconvertoraddmoreids: Used as the legend of the form in Special:BitIDConvert
bitidconvertsuccesstext:
Used as page body.

The page title for this message is {{msg-mw|Openidconvertsuccess}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - BitID URL
bitid-convert-already-your-bitid-text:
Warning text in case a user tried to add an BitID which is already associated to their account.

Parameters:
* $1 – the conflicting (already associated) BitID
bitid-convert-other-users-bitid-text:
Warning text in case a user tried to add an BitID which is already associated with an account of another user.

Parameters:
* $1 - the conflicting, already associated BitID
bitidnousername: Used as error message. (Commented out at this time.)
bitidbadusername: Used as error message. (Commented out at this time.)
bitidautosubmit: {{doc-important|"Continue" will never be localised. It is hardcoded in a PHP extension. Translations could be made like ""Continue" (translation)"}}
bitidclientonlytext:
Used as error message. Its title is {{msg-mw|Openiderror}}.

This is also used as "404 Not Found" page body in Special:BitIDXRDS.
bitidupdateuserinfo:
Used in Special:BitIDLogin.

This message is followed by list of BitID attributes (nickname, email and/or language).
bitiddelete-text:
Refers to {{msg-mw|Openiddelete-button}}.

Followed by the "Delete" form.

Parameters:
* $1 - the URL of the removed site
bitiddeleteerrornopassword:
Used as error message in Special:BitIDConvert.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|bitiderror}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Openiddeleteerrorbitidonly}}
bitiddeleteerrorbitidonly:
Used as error message in Special:BitIDConvert.

The title for this error message is {{msg-mw|bitiderror}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Openiddeleteerrornopassword}}
bitid-bitids-were-not-merged: When merging user accounts by UserMerge or similar extensions, BitID(s) are not merged if $wgBitIDMergeOnAccountMerge=false (default).
prefs-bitid-show-bitid: Label of a Special:Preference section about BitID: if you log in with BitID, you can hide your BitID URL on your user page.
prefs-bitid-associated-bitids: Your BitIDs for login to this wiki (section header)
prefs-bitid-local-identity: Your BitID for login to other sites (section header)
bitid-show-bitid-addr-on-userpage-user: Used as label for the checkbox in [[Special:Preferences]], if $wgBitIDShowUrlOnUserPage is "user".
bitid-userinfo-update-on-login-label: Update the following information from BitID persona every time the user logs in: (preference label)
bitid-associated-bitids-label: BitIDs associated with your account: (preference label)
bitid-addrs-registration: Used in the same way as {{msg-mw|prefs-registration}}
bitid-addrs-registration-date-time:
{{optional}}
Used in the same way as {{msg-mw|Prefs-registration-date-time}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - timestamp (time and date)
* $2 - (Optional) date
* $3 - (Optional) time
bitid-add-url: Used as link text. It is a link to Special:BitIDConvert.
bitid-trusted-sites-label: Sites you trust and where you have used your BitID for logging in: (preference label)
bitid-trusted-sites-table-header-column-:
Trusted sites (table header, URL column).
{{Identical|Trusted site}}
bitid-trusted-sites-delete-all-link-acti: A text for the link in the table to click to delete all trusted sites, e.g. "Delete all trusted sites"
bitid-trusted-sites-delete-confirmation-:
The question of by clicking the {{msg-mw|bitid-trusted-sites-delete-confirmation-button-text}} button, you will remove $1 from the list of sites you trust.

Parameters:
* $1 - the URL of the removed site
bitid-trusted-sites-delete-all-confirmat: The question of by clicking the {{msg-mw|Openid-trusted-sites-delete-confirmation-button-text}} button, you will remove all trusted sites from the list.
bitid-trusted-sites-delete-confirmation-:
A confirmation text which is shown, when the user has successfully removed a site from the list of trusted site.

Parameters:
* $1 - the URL of the removed site
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Openid-trusted-sites-delete-all-confirmation-success-text}}
bitid-local-identity: Your BitID when used a identity to other sites (preference label)
bitid-login-or-create-account: Used as fieldset label for the login form.
